Home > external > kegg > getGenesFromKEGG.m

getGenesFromKEGG

PURPOSE

getGenesFromKEGG

SYNOPSIS

function model=getGenesFromKEGG(keggPath,koList)

DESCRIPTION 

 getGenesFromKEGG
   Retrieves information on all genes stored in KEGG database

   Input:
   keggPath    if keggGenes.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
               directory, this function will attempt to read data from a
               local FTP dump of the KEGG database. keggPath is the path
               to the root of this database
   koList      the number of genes in KEGG is very large. koList can be a
               cell array with KO identifiers, in which case only genes
               belonging to one of those KEGG orthologies are retrieved
               (opt, default all KOs with associated reactions)

   Output:
   model       a model structure generated from the database. The
               following fields are filled
       id              'KEGG'
       name     'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
       rxns            KO ids
       rxnNames        Name for each entry
       genes           IDs for all the genes. Genes are saved as organism
                       abbreviation:id (same as in KEGG). 'HSA:124' for
                       example is alcohol dehydrogenase in Homo sapiens
       rxnGeneMat      A binary matrix that indicates whether a specific
                       gene is present in a KO id

   NOTE: If the file keggGenes.mat is in the RAVEN\external\kegg directory
   it will be loaded instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not
   exist it will be saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you
   should remove the keggGenes.mat file if you want to rebuild the model
   structure from a newer version of KEGG.

   Usage: model=getGenesFromKEGG(keggPath,koList)

 NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file

 ENTRY       K11440                      KO
 NAME        gbsB
 DEFINITION  choline dehydrogenase [EC:1.1.1.1]
 PATHWAY     ko00260  Glycine, serine and threonine metabolism
             ko01100  Metabolic pathways
 MODULE      M00555  Betaine biosynthesis, choline => betaine
 BRITE       KEGG Orthology (KO) [BR:ko00001]
             (list truncated)
 DBLINKS     RN: R08557 R08558
             COG: COG1454
 GENES       BSU: BSU31050(gbsB)
             BSR: I33_3189
             (list truncated)
 REFERENCE   PMID:8752328
   AUTHORS   Boch J, Kempf B, Schmid R, Bremer E
   TITLE     Synthesis of the osmoprotectant glycine... (truncated)
   JOURNAL   J Bacteriol 178:5121-9 (1996)
             DOI:10.1128/JB.178.17.5121-5129.1996
   SEQUENCE  [bsu:BSU31050]
 ///

 The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
 (except for '///').

 Check if the genes have been parsed before and saved. If so, load the
 model.

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function allKOs=getAllKOs(keggPath)

SOURCE CODE 

0001 function model=getGenesFromKEGG(keggPath,koList)
0002 % getGenesFromKEGG
0003 %   Retrieves information on all genes stored in KEGG database
0004 %
0005 %   Input:
0006 %   keggPath    if keggGenes.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
0007 %               directory, this function will attempt to read data from a
0008 %               local FTP dump of the KEGG database. keggPath is the path
0009 %               to the root of this database
0010 %   koList      the number of genes in KEGG is very large. koList can be a
0011 %               cell array with KO identifiers, in which case only genes
0012 %               belonging to one of those KEGG orthologies are retrieved
0013 %               (opt, default all KOs with associated reactions)
0014 %
0015 %   Output:
0016 %   model       a model structure generated from the database. The
0017 %               following fields are filled
0018 %       id              'KEGG'
0019 %       name     'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
0020 %       rxns            KO ids
0021 %       rxnNames        Name for each entry
0022 %       genes           IDs for all the genes. Genes are saved as organism
0023 %                       abbreviation:id (same as in KEGG). 'HSA:124' for
0024 %                       example is alcohol dehydrogenase in Homo sapiens
0025 %       rxnGeneMat      A binary matrix that indicates whether a specific
0026 %                       gene is present in a KO id
0027 %
0028 %   NOTE: If the file keggGenes.mat is in the RAVEN\external\kegg directory
0029 %   it will be loaded instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not
0030 %   exist it will be saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you
0031 %   should remove the keggGenes.mat file if you want to rebuild the model
0032 %   structure from a newer version of KEGG.
0033 %
0034 %   Usage: model=getGenesFromKEGG(keggPath,koList)
0035 %
0036 % NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file
0037 %
0038 % ENTRY       K11440                      KO
0039 % NAME        gbsB
0040 % DEFINITION  choline dehydrogenase [EC:1.1.1.1]
0041 % PATHWAY     ko00260  Glycine, serine and threonine metabolism
0042 %             ko01100  Metabolic pathways
0043 % MODULE      M00555  Betaine biosynthesis, choline => betaine
0044 % BRITE       KEGG Orthology (KO) [BR:ko00001]
0045 %             (list truncated)
0046 % DBLINKS     RN: R08557 R08558
0047 %             COG: COG1454
0048 % GENES       BSU: BSU31050(gbsB)
0049 %             BSR: I33_3189
0050 %             (list truncated)
0051 % REFERENCE   PMID:8752328
0052 %   AUTHORS   Boch J, Kempf B, Schmid R, Bremer E
0053 %   TITLE     Synthesis of the osmoprotectant glycine... (truncated)
0054 %   JOURNAL   J Bacteriol 178:5121-9 (1996)
0055 %             DOI:10.1128/JB.178.17.5121-5129.1996
0056 %   SEQUENCE  [bsu:BSU31050]
0057 % ///
0058 %
0059 % The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
0060 % (except for '///').
0061 %
0062 % Check if the genes have been parsed before and saved. If so, load the
0063 % model.
0064 %
0065 
0066 if nargin<1
0067     keggPath='RAVEN/external/kegg';
0068 end
0069 
0070 ravenPath=findRAVENroot();
0071 genesFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggGenes.mat');
0072 if exist(genesFile, 'file')
0073     fprintf(['Importing KEGG genes from ' strrep(genesFile,'\','/') '... ']);
0074     load(genesFile);
0075 else
0076     fprintf(['NOTE: Cannot locate ' strrep(genesFile,'\','/') ', it will therefore be generated from the local KEGG database\n']);
0077     if ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'ko'),'file') || ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction'),'file')
0078         EM=fprintf(['The files ''ko'' and ''reaction'' cannot be located at ' strrep(keggPath,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP\n']);
0079         dispEM(EM);
0080     else
0081         fprintf('Generating keggGenes.mat file... ');
0082         %Get all KOs that are associated to reactions
0083         allKOs=getAllKOs(keggPath);
0084         
0085         %Since the list of genes will be accessed many times the hash table
0086         %is established
0087         geneMap=containers.Map('KeyType','char','ValueType','int32');
0088         
0089         %Add new functionality in the order specified in models
0090         model.id='KEGG';
0091         model.name='Automatically generated from KEGG database';
0092         
0093         %Preallocate memory
0094         model.rxns=cell(numel(allKOs),1);
0095         model.rxnNames=cell(numel(allKOs),1);
0096         
0097         %Reserve space for 500000 genes
0098         model.genes=cell(500000,1);
0099         
0100         %Load information on KO ID, name, and associated genes
0101         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'ko'), 'r');
0102         
0103         %Keeps track of how many KOs that have been added
0104         koCounter=0;
0105         nGenes=0;
0106         addingGenes=false;
0107         
0108         %These contain the mapping between KOs and genes and are used to
0109         %generate the model.rxnGeneMat in the end
0110         koIndex=zeros(5000000,1);
0111         geneIndex=koIndex;
0112         nMappings=0;
0113         
0114         skipRead=false;
0115         
0116         %Loop through the file
0117         while 1
0118             %Get the next line
0119             if skipRead==false
0120                 tline = fgetl(fid);
0121             else
0122                 skipRead=false;
0123             end
0124             
0125             %Abort at end of file
0126             if ~ischar(tline)
0127                 break;
0128             end
0129             
0130             %Skip '///'
0131             if numel(tline)<12
0132                 addingGenes=false;
0133                 continue;
0134             end
0135             
0136             %Check if it's a new reaction
0137             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'ENTRY       ')
0138                 %Check if it should be added
0139                 koID=tline(13:18);
0140                 
0141                 if ismember(koID,allKOs)
0142                     addMe=true;
0143                     koCounter=koCounter+1;
0144                 else
0145                     addMe=false;
0146                     continue;
0147                 end
0148                 
0149                 %Add reaction ID (always 6 characters)
0150                 model.rxns{koCounter}=koID;
0151                 
0152                 model.rxnNames{koCounter}='';
0153                 %Will be overwritten if it exists
0154             end
0155             
0156             %To get here we must be in a KO that should be added
0157             if addMe==true
0158                 %Add name
0159                 if strcmp(tline(1:12),'DEFINITION  ')
0160                     model.rxnNames{koCounter}=tline(13:end);
0161                 end
0162                 
0163                 %Check if it's time to start adding genes
0164                 if strcmp(tline(1:12),'GENES       ')
0165                     addingGenes=true;
0166                 end
0167                 
0168                 %Add genes
0169                 if addingGenes==true
0170                     %We are now adding genes for the current KO. All gene
0171                     %rows start with 12 spaces. If this is not true it
0172                     %means that there is additional annotation such as
0173                     %AUTHORS. This is not common but it exists
0174                     if strcmp(tline(1:12),'            ') || strcmp(tline(1:12),'GENES       ')
0175                         geneLine=tline(13:end);
0176                         
0177                         %Check if the line is from a new organism of from
0178                         %the same as before
0179                         if strcmp(geneLine(4),':')
0180                             %If organism id contains 3 letters;
0181                             currentOrganism=geneLine(1:3);
0182                             %Parse the string
0183                             genes=regexp(geneLine(6:end),' ','split');
0184                             genes=strcat(currentOrganism,':',genes(:));
0185                         elseif strcmp(geneLine(5),':')
0186                             %If organism id contains 4 letters;
0187                             currentOrganism=geneLine(1:4);
0188                             %Parse the string
0189                             genes=regexp(geneLine(7:end),' ','split');
0190                             genes=strcat(currentOrganism,':',genes(:));
0191                         end
0192                         
0193                         %Add the genes to the gene list
0194                         for i=1:numel(genes)
0195                             geneString=genes{i};
0196                             if geneMap.isKey(geneString)
0197                                 index=geneMap(geneString);
0198                             else
0199                                 nGenes=nGenes+1;
0200                                 model.genes{nGenes}=geneString;
0201                                 index=nGenes;
0202                                 geneMap(geneString)=index;
0203                             end
0204                             
0205                             %Add the connection to the KO
0206                             nMappings=nMappings+1;
0207                             koIndex(nMappings)=koCounter;
0208                             geneIndex(nMappings)=index;
0209                         end
0210                     else
0211                         %Now we want to throw away everything until the
0212                         %next entry
0213                         while 1
0214                             tline = fgetl(fid);
0215                             if strcmp(tline,'///')
0216                                 %When the new entry is found, skip reading
0217                                 %one line to fit with the rest of the code
0218                                 skipRead=true;
0219                                 break;
0220                             end
0221                         end
0222                     end
0223                 end
0224             end
0225         end
0226         %Close the file
0227         fclose(fid);
0228         
0229         %If too much space was allocated, shrink the model
0230         model.rxns=model.rxns(1:koCounter);
0231         model.rxnNames=model.rxnNames(1:koCounter);
0232         model.genes=model.genes(1:nGenes);
0233         
0234         %Retrieve and add the gene associations
0235         model.rxnGeneMat=sparse(koIndex(1:nMappings),geneIndex(1:nMappings),ones(nMappings,1));
0236         
0237         %To make sure the size is correct if the last KOs don't have genes
0238         if size(model.rxnGeneMat,1)~=koCounter
0239             model.rxnGeneMat(koCounter,1)=0;
0240         end
0241         
0242         %Trim the genes so that they only contain information that can be
0243         %matched to the KEGG file of protein sequences (remove all
0244         %information after first parenthesis)
0245         %NOTE: For some reason the organism abbreviation should be in lower
0246         %case in this database. Fix this here
0247         for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0248             parIndex=strfind(model.genes{i},'(');
0249             if any(parIndex)
0250                 model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(1:parIndex-1);
0251             end
0252             colIndex=strfind(model.genes{i},':');
0253             model.genes{i}=[lower(model.genes{i}(1:colIndex-1)) model.genes{i}(colIndex:end)];
0254         end
0255         
0256         %Save the model structure
0257         save(genesFile,'model');
0258     end
0259 end
0260 
0261 %Only get the KOs in koList
0262 I=~ismember(model.rxns,koList);
0263 model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
0264 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0265 end
0266 
0267 function allKOs=getAllKOs(keggPath)
0268 %Retrieves all KOs that are associated to reactions. This is because the
0269 %number of genes in KEGG is very large so without this parsing it would
0270 %take many hours
0271 
0272 allKOs={};
0273 
0274 %First check if the reactions have already been parsed
0275 ravenPath=findRAVENroot;
0276 rxnsFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggRxns.mat');
0277 if exist(rxnsFile, 'file')
0278     fprintf(['NOTE: Importing KEGG ORTHOLOGY list from ' strrep(rxnsFile,'\','/') '.\n']);
0279     load(rxnsFile,'model');
0280     
0281     %Loop through the reactions and add the corresponding genes
0282     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0283         if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
0284             %Get all KOs
0285             allKOs=[allKOs;model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(strcmpi(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name,'kegg.orthology'))];
0286         end
0287     end
0288 else
0289     %Parse the reaction file instead First load information on reaction ID,
0290     %reaction name, KO, pathway and ec-number
0291     fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction'), 'r');
0292     orthology=false;
0293     while 1
0294         %Get the next line
0295         tline = fgetl(fid);
0296         
0297         %Abort at end of file
0298         if ~ischar(tline)
0299             break;
0300         end
0301         
0302         %Skip '///'
0303         if numel(tline)<12
0304             continue;
0305         end
0306         
0307         %Check if it's a new reaction
0308         if strcmp(tline(1:12),'ENTRY       ')
0309             orthology=false;
0310         end
0311         
0312         if strcmp(tline(1:9),'REFERENCE')
0313             orthology=false;
0314         end
0315         
0316         %Add KO-ids
0317         if numel(tline)>16
0318             if strcmp(tline(1:16),'ORTHOLOGY   KO: ') || strcmp(tline(1:16),'            KO: ') || strcmp(tline(1:12),'ORTHOLOGY   ') || orthology==true
0319                 if strcmp(tline(13:16),'KO:')
0320                     %This is in the old version
0321                     allKOs=[allKOs;tline(17:22)];
0322                 elseif strcmp(tline(1:12),'ORTHOLOGY   ')
0323                     %This means that it found one KO in the new format and
0324                     %that subsequent lines might be other KOs
0325                     orthology=true;
0326                     allKOs=[allKOs;tline(13:18)];
0327                 end
0328             end
0329         end
0330     end
0331     
0332     %Close the file
0333     fclose(fid);
0334 end
0335 allKOs=unique(allKOs);
0336 end
